html: An agricultural economy characterizes Jehovah’s millennial reign of peace: “Then will he water with rain the seed you sow in the ground, that the land’s increase of food may be rich and abundant. In that day your cattle shall graze in ample pasturelands, and the oxen and asses that till the soil eat grain silage winnowed with shovel and fork” (Isaiah 30:23-24; cf. 32:20; 55:10: 62:8-9). Jehovah’s people who inherit promised lands are those who seek him: “They who seek refuge in me shall possess the earth and receive an inheritance in my holy mountain” (Isaiah 57:13b; cf. 26:8-9; 34:16-17; 51:1).
